programme.title: The Big Break

programme.title: The Big Break

programme.title: The Big Break

programme.title: The Big Break

programme.title: The Big Break

programme.title: Breaking Your Slice With Nathalie Sheehan

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.sub-title: Six in One, Half-Dozen in the Other
programme.desc: Together six men and six women comprise two teams for the ultimate prize of $100,000 and a chance to play in a PGA Tour or LPGA tournament. Featuring Golf Channel's Blair O'Neal.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: One on one, man versus woman, and in the blazing heat of the Dominican Republic, the teams try to keep their composure while competing in the dangerously new challenge Strike Eraser. Featuring Golf Channel's Blair O'Neal.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.sub-title: Kill Two Birds With One Stone
programme.desc: One team loses a competitor after that player must leave for the hospital due to illness. The stakes get higher when the Flop Wall now leads two competitors to the benching challenge. Featuring Golf Channel's Blair O'Neal.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: Both teams try their luck in "Take a Chance" and battle for their professional lives. Players are subject to the "Benching Challenge" where cash and elimination are on the line. Featuring Golf Channel's Blair O'Neal.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: The ups and downs of the grueling competition are wearing on the teams as a multitude of events are staged. You can cut the tension with a knife as both teams fall victim to internal fighting that might start to de-rail the weaker players.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: An overnight rain delay causes more tension when a couple players must waitanother day to compete. Finally both teams go head-to-head to beat elimination and win cash. Featuring Golf Channel's Blair O'Neal.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: The teams compete in an "Around the World" challenge testing their chipping and putting skills. As the drama unfolds, some friends turn to enemies and survival is put to the test as the teams try to make it one step closer to the finale.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.sub-title: Birds of a Feather Flock Together
programme.desc: Two players become the clear cut MVPs, while the rest of the competitors do their best to make up lost ground. It's every player for themselves as a short game and closest to the pin challenge result in two unlikely winners.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: The most points in any competition are at stake and a player falls ill creating a make or break situation for the teams.

programme.title: The Big Break
programme.desc: In the finale, the men's and women's team battle it out for cash, prizes and professional exemptions.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Learn unique drills using a cell phone charger, headcover, rope and tree branch that will all increase your clubhead speed; Devan will also give an in-depth swing analysis on Cameron Young and teach his checkpoints for maximum power.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Devan Bonebrake is fixing the biggest contact faults to make you a better ball striker; learn how a wall can be used to cure fat and thin shots plus Devan's best drill for preventing the shanks.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Devan Bonebrake is teaching how to stick your wedges and make more birdies; learn the biggest swing keys that make Justin Thomas one of the best wedge players in the world.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Devan Bonebrake is putting you on a path to lower scores by improving your swing path; learn setup adjustments, swing keys and creative drills for hitting draws and fades on command.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Learn how cross-handed chipping helped Matthew Fitzpatrick win the U.S. Open, keys to spinning your wedges like Max Homa and the reason John Daly practices one-arm pitch shots.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Learn creative drills to train a better downswing and find out how Michael Jackson's moonwalk will improve your impact; Devan will also reveal a tip for the transition used by Viktor Hovland.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Devan Bonebrake will reveal the most important swing angles and teach you how to achieve those positions; learn Devan's favorite drills for ideal angles in the backswing, downswing, at impact and in the finish.

programme.title: The Golf Fix
programme.desc: Devan Bonebrake is teaching how to use ground forces to maximize your power; learn how a tennis ball, yoga block, kettlebell and exercise band can be used to train for more distance.
